Sentence: a palestinian terrorist leader wanted for a deadly 1985 cruise ship hijacking is in u . s. custody in iraq. u . s. sources tell cnn mohammed " abu " abbas was captured about 50 miles west of baghdad. palestinian sources say he had tried to flee into syria , but was turned away at the border. in october of 1985 , four hijackers under his command took over the italian cruise ship " achille lauro " and killed a wheelchair- bound american tourist , leo klinghoffer. abbas was convicted in absentia by an italian court and sentenced to five life terms in prison .
